I thought clang will fix 80 chars, but it didnt for string is lg2, fixing
I guess lg2 didn't accept just passing in FAULTLOG_DUMP_PATH directly?
Does lg2 handle this any better or is this still needed?
Yes this still needed for lg2 too
Lg2 is also deoen't like enums , Good place to fix in lg2 level , by adding osstream related fix mentioned in https://github.com/fmtlib/fmt/issues/391.
A bunch of nits.  Overall looks good.  Thank you for doing the conversion.
For consistency with other repos, I'd suggest just "ERROR" here.  We've typically used ERROR for exceptions and ERRNO for errnos.
Definitely be consistent within the repo.  You've used ERROR_MSG and EXCEPTION_MSG in the same code.
If lg2 doesn't already support simply doing `file` here, please open an issue to phosphor-logging and I'll add it.
Pushing a new patch to remove the header
Why do you want these removed?  Isn’t “include-what-you-use” a better philosophy than relying on getting one header as a side-effect of another one?
